intro: Myrsine asymmetrica subsp. paniensis, commonly known as the Panis Island myrsine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually elliptical, glossy, and have a slightly serrated edge. The flowers are small, white or pale pink, and clustered in dense inflorescences, attracting various pollinators.
